byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez and Timothy Williams contributed reporting.

abstract: Residents of Chattanooga, Tenn, many of them with ties to military, share feelings of grief and patriotism after fatal shooting of four Marines and one Navy seaman; anger at gunman Mohammod Abdulazeez is also common and feelings are mixed regarding city's sizable Muslim community.
lead_paragraph: The expression of patriotism and pride was the most visible emotion during the weekend in Chattanooga, Tenn., where Mohammod Abdulazeez killed the five servicemen in a bloody rampage Thursday.

headline.main: Chattanooga Wears Pride Beside Its Pain After Killings
headline.print_headline: Chattanooga Wears Pride Beside Its Pain After Killings
